Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1

getSelection().focusOffset has wrong value if selection was enlarged and squeezed by clicking left mouse button with SHIFT key.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.load attached test page
2.select first word. after that getSelection().focusOffset=10
3.press SHIFT and click after second word, thus enlarging selection to two words. after that getSelection().focusOffset=21
4.press SHIFT and click after first word, thus squeezing selection back to one word. after that still getSelection().focusOffset=21


Expected Results:  
After step 4 getSelection().focusOffset must be equal 10, not 21.

FF 3.6 also have this bug. Why you dont fix it?
comments.author: CoolCmd@gmail.com
comments.creator: CoolCmd@gmail.com

comments.raw_text:
this looks wrong. Calling HandleEvent twice is not expected.

In fact, is this a bug? Selection handling just happens after mouseup.
If this is needed for compatibility with some other browsers, then
we should move all the selection handling to happen before
mouseup is dispatched to DOM.
comments.creator: bugs@pettay.fi
